subject: Re: generate offline reports
msgSnippet: Hi, Using and configuring ANT is the best way of achieving this. However, if you dont want to / dont know how to use ANT then you can achieve the same thing by
messageBody:
Hi,

Using and configuring ANT is the best way of achieving this. However,
if you dont want to / dont know how to use ANT then you can achieve
the same thing by extending the TestRunner class (say ModTestRunner)
and overriding the addError, addFailure methods etc. to point out
output to a file.

- Nilesh

--- In junit@y..., Sivarama Krishnan <siva_2000_1@y...> wrote:
> Is there anyway to generate Offline test reports using
> JUNIT?
>
> Can anyone help me in achieving this!
>
> Thanka in advance.
>
> Regards,
> Sivaramakrishnan
